Line 66: Line 66:
In addition to its use in pornography, the term has been used as a [[punch line]] or for rhetorical effect. As part of the 42nd Street Art Project in 1994, designer [[Adelle Lutz]] turned a former shop in [[Times Square]] called American Male into "American She-Male", with brightly-colored mannequins and clothes made of condoms.<ref name="sagalyn">Sagalyn, Lynne B. (2003). ''Times Square Roulette: Remaking the City Icon.'' MIT Press, ISBN 9780262692953</ref> The 2004 ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]'' episode "[[Sad Sack (Arrested Development episode)|Sad Sack]]" had a gag where Maeby tricks Lindsay into wearing a shirt that says "ShÃ©male", in order to convince a suitor Lindsay is transgender. Film critic [[Manohla Dargis]] has written about the lack of "real women" in summer blockbusters, claiming [[Judd Apatow]] comedies feature men who act more like leading ladies: "These aren't the she-males you find in the back pages of ''[[The Village Voice]]'', mind you. The Apatow men hit the screen anatomically intact: theyâre emasculated but not castrated, as the repeated images of the flopping genitals in ''[[Forgetting Sarah Marshall]]'' remind you."<ref name="dargis2009">Dargis, Manola (May 4, 2008). [http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/04/movies/moviesspecial/04dargi.html Is There a Real Woman in This Multiplex?] ''[[New York Times]]''</ref>
In addition to its use in pornography, the term has been used as a [[punch line]] or for rhetorical effect. As part of the 42nd Street Art Project in 1994, designer [[Adelle Lutz]] turned a former shop in [[Times Square]] called American Male into "American She-Male", with brightly-colored mannequins and clothes made of condoms.<ref name="sagalyn">Sagalyn, Lynne B. (2003). ''Times Square Roulette: Remaking the City Icon.'' MIT Press, ISBN 9780262692953</ref> The 2004 ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]'' episode "[[Sad Sack (Arrested Development episode)|Sad Sack]]" had a gag where Maeby tricks Lindsay into wearing a shirt that says "ShÃ©male", in order to convince a suitor Lindsay is transgender. Film critic [[Manohla Dargis]] has written about the lack of "real women" in summer blockbusters, claiming [[Judd Apatow]] comedies feature men who act more like leading ladies: "These aren't the she-males you find in the back pages of ''[[The Village Voice]]'', mind you. The Apatow men hit the screen anatomically intact: theyâre emasculated but not castrated, as the repeated images of the flopping genitals in ''[[Forgetting Sarah Marshall]]'' remind you."<ref name="dargis2009">Dargis, Manola (May 4, 2008). [http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/04/movies/moviesspecial/04dargi.html Is There a Real Woman in This Multiplex?] ''[[New York Times]]''</ref>

A lot of pornography that are claimed to be shemales are actually just girls that have had photoshopped penis's put on the photograph. The reference (which is a picture of the Milton Twins) proves this. <ref>http://galleries2.adult-empire.com/79/7904//0120/p/2.jpg</ref>
